segment.source: Using the Compatibility Administrator Tool (Windows 10)
segment.target: Using the Compatibility Administrator Tool (Windows 10)

segment.source: This section provides information about using the Compatibility Administrator tool.
segment.target: This section provides information about using the Compatibility Administrator tool.

segment.source: Using the Compatibility Administrator Tool
segment.target: Using the Compatibility Administrator Tool

segment.target: Applies to

segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This section provides information about using the Compatibility Administrator tool.
segment.target: This section provides information about using the Compatibility Administrator tool.

segment.source: In this section
segment.target: In this section

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Available Data Types and Operators in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Available Data Types and Operators in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: The Compatibility Administrator tool provides a way to query your custom-compatibility databases.
segment.target: The Compatibility Administrator tool provides a way to query your custom-compatibility databases.

segment.source: Searching for Fixed Applications in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Searching for Fixed Applications in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: With the search functionality in Compatibility Administrator, you can locate specific executable (.exe) files with previously applied compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, or AppHelp messages.
segment.target: With the search functionality in Compatibility Administrator, you can locate specific executable (.exe) files with previously applied compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, or AppHelp messages.

segment.source: This is particularly useful if you are trying to identify applications with a specific compatibility fix or identifying which fixes are applied to a specific application.
segment.target: This is particularly useful if you are trying to identify applications with a specific compatibility fix or identifying which fixes are applied to a specific application.

segment.source: Searching for Installed Compatibility Fixes with the Query Tool in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Searching for Installed Compatibility Fixes with the Query Tool in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: You can access the Query tool from within Compatibility Administrator.
segment.target: You can access the Query tool from within Compatibility Administrator.

segment.source: The Query tool provides the same functionality as using the Search feature.
segment.target: The Query tool provides the same functionality as using the Search feature.

segment.source: Creating a Custom Compatibility Fix in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Creating a Custom Compatibility Fix in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: The Compatibility Administrator tool uses the term fix to describe the combination of compatibility information added to a customized database for a specific application.
segment.target: The Compatibility Administrator tool uses the term fix to describe the combination of compatibility information added to a customized database for a specific application.

segment.source: This combination can include single application fixes, groups of fixes that work together as a compatibility mode, and blocking and non-blocking AppHelp messages.
segment.target: This combination can include single application fixes, groups of fixes that work together as a compatibility mode, and blocking and non-blocking AppHelp messages.

segment.source: Creating a Custom Compatibility Mode in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Creating a Custom Compatibility Mode in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: Windows® provides several compatibility modes, groups of compatibility fixes found to resolve many common application-compatibility issues.
segment.target: Windows® provides several compatibility modes, groups of compatibility fixes found to resolve many common application-compatibility issues.

segment.source: While working with Compatibility Administrator, you might decide to group some of your individual compatibility fixes into a custom-compatibility mode, which you can then deploy and use on any of your compatibility databases.
segment.target: While working with Compatibility Administrator, you might decide to group some of your individual compatibility fixes into a custom-compatibility mode, which you can then deploy and use on any of your compatibility databases.

segment.source: Creating an AppHelp Message in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Creating an AppHelp Message in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: The Compatibility Administrator tool enables you to create an AppHelp text message.
segment.target: The Compatibility Administrator tool enables you to create an AppHelp text message.

segment.source: This is a blocking or non-blocking message that appears when a user starts an application that you know has major functionality issues on the Windows® operating system.
segment.target: This is a blocking or non-blocking message that appears when a user starts an application that you know has major functionality issues on the Windows® operating system.

segment.source: Viewing the Events Screen in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Viewing the Events Screen in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: The Events screen enables you to record and to view your activities in the Compatibility Administrator tool, provided that the screen is open while you perform the activities.
segment.target: The Events screen enables you to record and to view your activities in the Compatibility Administrator tool, provided that the screen is open while you perform the activities.

segment.source: Enabling and Disabling Compatibility Fixes in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Enabling and Disabling Compatibility Fixes in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: You can disable and enable individual compatibility fixes in your customized databases for testing and troubleshooting purposes.
segment.target: You can disable and enable individual compatibility fixes in your customized databases for testing and troubleshooting purposes.

segment.source: Installing and Uninstalling Custom Compatibility Databases in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Installing and Uninstalling Custom Compatibility Databases in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: The Compatibility Administrator tool enables the creation and the use of custom-compatibility and standard-compatibility databases.
segment.target: The Compatibility Administrator tool enables the creation and the use of custom-compatibility and standard-compatibility databases.

segment.source: Both the custom databases and the standard databases store the known compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages.
segment.target: Both the custom databases and the standard databases store the known compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages.

segment.source: They also store the required application-matching information for installation on your local computers.
segment.target: They also store the required application-matching information for installation on your local computers.
